body_text.text: HeLa-Vector or -IFITM3 cells stably transduced with RAB7-red fluorescence protein (RFP, red) were incubated with a mixture of both yellow (pH-sensitive, green) and blue (pH-insensitive, blue) dye-labeled dextrans with or without pretreatment with AmphoB.
body_text.section: Fig S2 Effect of IFITM3 and AmphoB on endosomal pH and HA acidification (A)

body_text.text: Values represent the average ratios of pH-sensitive dextran signal to pH-insensitive dextran signal in the RAB7 compartment for three independent experiments +/-SD. pQCXIP-IFITM3 for transducing A549 and HeLa cells were described previously (Feeley et al., 2011) . The IFITM3 alanine scan (AS) mutants, 109AS, 115AS, and 121AS, spanning IM2 each contain six sequential residues changed to alanine and were expressed using the pQCXIP vector as previously described (John et al., 2013) ; however, we note that 115AS was previously reported by us to be unable to be expressed (John et al., 2013) , however a more concerted effort in this current work was able to produce a cell line stably expressing the 115AS protein. Human RAB7 was cloned in frame with RFP and expressed from the lentiviral vector pLVX-puromycin Pseudoparticles were produced using the noted envelopes as previously described (Brass et al., 2009; Feeley et al., 2011; Huang et al., 2011) Small

BIBREF5.title: Gag/pol plasmids were used in turn with each of the envelopes to produce the internal components of the pseudotyped particles. The pseudotyped virus particles were concentrated and purified by ultracentrifugation through a 20% sucrose cushion using a Beckman SW 28 rotor @ 22

BIBREF6.title: The antiviral effector IFITM3 disrupts intracellular cholesterol homeostasis to block viral entry

BIBREF7.title: The IFITM proteins mediate cellular resistance to influenza A H1N1 virus, West Nile virus, and dengue virus

BIBREF8.title: IFITM3 restricts the morbidity and mortality associated with influenza

BIBREF9.title: IFITM3 inhibits influenza A virus infection by preventing cytosolic entry

BIBREF10.title: Distinct patterns of IFITMmediated restriction of filoviruses, SARS coronavirus, and influenza A virus

BIBREF11.title: The CD225 Domain of IFITM3 Is Required for both IFITM Protein Association and Inhibition of Influenza A Virus and Dengue Virus Replication

BIBREF12.title: Changes in the antigenicity of the hemagglutinin molecule of H3 influenza virus at acidic pH

FIGREF0.text: S1 AmphoB overcomes IFITM3's block to IAV fusion (A) A549-Vector or -IFITM3 cells were treated with buffer or AmphoB, then challenged with IAV WSN/33 (moi 2). Cells were fixed at 12h post-infection and immunostained for HA-expression (green). The percentage of infected cells are provided and are representative of three separate experiments as determined by imaging analysis software. cell nuclei (blue). 4X magnification. (B) Immunoblot of cell lines in (A). (C) A549-Vector or -IFITM3 cells were treated with buffer or AmphoB, then challenged with IAV WSN/33. At 12h post-infection the viral supernatant was removed from the A549 cell-containing wells and placed in a well-by-well arrayed manner on a fresh plate of MDCK cells that had not been treated with AmphoB. Cells were fixed at 12h postinfection and immunostained for HA-expression (green). Numbers represent the percentage of infected cells and are representative of three separate experiments as determined by imaging software analysis. A549 and MDCK cell nuclei (blue). 4X magnification. (D) Immunoblot of A549 and HeLa cells lines stably transduced with an empty retroviral vector (Vector) or one expressing IFITM3 (M3) and treated or not treated with IFN-a for 16hr. (E) AmphoB time of addition experiment. A549-IFITM3 cells were incubated with 1 M AmphoB for the indicated times prior to infection with IAV WSN/33. After 12h cells were fixed and immunostained for HA. Numbers represent the mean percentage of infected cells of three separate experiments +/-SD. Blue bar represents infection percentage when A549-IFITM3 cells were incubated after media alone was added at time 0. (F) AmphoB exposure does not decrease IFITM3 expression levels. -IFITM3 immunoblot of the A549-Vector and -IFITM3 cell lines with or without incubation with 1 M AmphoB for 1hr.

FIGREF1.text: HeLa-Vector or -IFITM3 cells were infected with IAV with or without pretreatment with AmphoB. IAV entry was synchronized and cells were fixed at the indicated times thenimmunostained for either the acid-induced conformation of HA (monoclonal antibody A1, green) or both endogenous and overexpressed IFITM3 (orange). Images are representative of two independent experiments. Scale bar = 10 m. (C) TEA treatment prevents AmphoB pores from depleting endosomal Na + and H + levels. Quantitation of the confocal images in Fig. 3D showing the relative levels of endosomal sodium based on the fluorescent signal of ANG-2 in A549-Vector (blue) or -IFITM3 (red) cells with or without treatment with AmphoB, TEA or both. Similar results were obtained for ACh (data not shown). Values represent the mean of three independent experiments +/-SEM. (D) Quantitation of confocal images (similar to those in (A) but not shown) showing the relative levels of endosomal acidity based on the fluorescent dextran signals in HeLa-Vector (blue) or -IFITM3 (red) cells with or without treatment with AmphoB, TEA or both. Values represent the mean of three independent experiments +/-SEM. Fig S3 Role of cholesterol and IFITM3's intramembrane domain 2 (IM2) in IFITM3mediated restriction of IAV. (A) A549-Vector, -IFITM1 or -IFITM3 cells were treated with the indicated compounds then stained for cholesterol with filipin (white) and imaged using a confocal microscope. Magnification=63X. Scale bar = 10 M. (B, C) Quantitation of images in (A). Values represent the mean of three independent experiments +/-SD. (D) Immunoblot of A549-AS IM2 cell lines using the indicated antibodies. (E) The indicated A549-AS IM2 cell lines were infected with IAV WSN/33 for 12h then fixed and immunostained for HA expression. The red bar under the AS mutants denotes that they span the IM2 region depicted in red in the cartoon insert of IFITM3 residing in the membrane. Conserved intracellular loop = CIL. Values represent the mean of three independent experiments +/-SD. (F) The indicated A549-AS IM2 cell lines from (D, E) were stained for cholesterol with filipin (white), and immunostained for LAMP1 (red) and IFITM3 (green), then imaged using a confocal microscope. Magnification=63X. Scale bar = 10 M. (G) Quantitation of images in (F).

FIGREF2.text: AmphoB does not alter IFITM1's effects on either membrane fluidity or cell-to-cell fusion (A) COS-7 cells were stably transduced with retroviruses expressing either the empty vector (Vector), IFITM1, CAV1-teal fluorescence protein (TFP), or IFITM3. Vector cells (left column) as well as the indicated cell lines (right columns) were confocally imaged to detect TFP, IFITM1 or IFITM3 (all in green). Nuclear DNA was stained with DAPI (blue). Scale bar = 10 M. (B) AmphoB does not alter the decrease in membrane fluidity observed with IFITM1 expression. COS7-Vector or -IFITM1 cell fluorescence recovery with or without a 1 hr pre-treatment with AmphoB (1 M) was quantified using Leica Lite software, with each individual timepoint representing the average of 10 normalized readouts. PRISM software was then used to plot the best-fit exponential decay line. (C)AmphoB does not alter IFITM1's inhibition of IAV-induced cell-to-cell fusion. Cells were first incubated for 1 hr with AmphoB (1 M) then chilled prior to the addition of chilled IAV (PR8). After incubation with PR8, warm buffer (pH 5.0) was added followed by warm media. Cells were incubated for 5 hr then fixed and stained to monitor fusion events. Fusion events per 100 nuclei were calculated and values represent the average of 3-5 images from each of three independent experiments +/-SD.

FIGREF3.text: AmBisome alone does not induce weight loss in mice Wild-type (WT) andIfitm3 -/-(KO) mice were injected with 3 mg/kg of AmBisome on day 0, 2 and 4 and their weights monitored.Experimental Procedures:Plasmids: The retroviral empty vector control (Vector, pQCXIP, from Clontech) and

FIGREF4.text: Clontech), which contains a puromycin resistance cassette. IFITM3 chimeras were constructed as follows: IFITM3's N-terminal domain (NTD, amino acids 1-50) was fused in frame with IFITM1's amino acids 29-245 to generate M3M1. The NTD of IFITM1, amino acids 1-28, was fused to IFITM3, amino acids 51-119, to produce M1M3(John et al., 2013). Human CAV1 was subcloned into the XbaI and BamHI sites of the pLVXpuromycin vector in frame with a C-terminal teal fluorescence protein (TFP), and the coding sequence was confirmed as correct. For construction of pQCXIP-VAPA the transcript variant two of human VAPA (NM_194434.2) cDNA (kind gift of Dr. Jae Jung, UCLA Medical School) was amplified by PCR and cloned into the retroviral expression vector pQCXIP (Clontech) and the coding sequence was confirmed as correct. pQCXIP-VAPA and all other listed retroviral constructs were packaged into viruses using standard techniques and used to stably transduce the indicated cells(Brass et al., 2009).Cell lines: A549, MDCK, COS-7 and H1 HeLa cells (ATCC) were stably transduced with the indicated plasmids then selected for puromycin resistance (Clontech). All cells were cultured in DMEM (Invitrogen) with 10% FBS (Invitrogen). MEFs were derived, genotyped and cultured as described previously(Everitt et al., 2012). Human WT fibroblasts (GM05659, passage 10) and Neiman-Pick Type c1 fibroblasts (GM03123, passage 11) were from Coriell Institute.Virus propagation and infection: IAVA/WSN/33 (WSN/33, H1N1 a kind gift of Dr. Peter Palese, Mount Sinai School of Medicine, NY), A/California/7/2009 (H1N1, pH1N1, a kind gift of J. Malbry, CDC), A/Puerto Rico/8/1934 (H1N1, PR8, Charles River Labs), and A/Aichi/68 (H3N2, X31, Charles River Labs) were propagated and titered as previously described (Everitt et al., 2012; Feeley et al., 2011). IAV-infected cells were fixed 12h post infection using 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA, Sigma) in Dulbecco's PBS (D-PBS, Invitrogen). IAV-infected cells were immunostained for HA expression using either an anti-HA monoclonal (WSN/3 and PR8, Wistar Institute, (Feeley et al., 2011)) or anti-NP antibodies (Millipore clone H16-L10-4R5 anti-influenza A virus antibody). IAVinfected cells were then immunostained with a secondary antibody, goat anti-mouse conjugated with Alexaflour-488 at 1:1000 (Invitrogen) in D-PBS with 1% BSA. Host cell DNA was stained with Hoescht 33342 (Sigma) in D-PBS (1:10,000). Cells were imaged on an automated Image Express Micro (IXM) microscope (Molecular Devices) and analyzed using the Metamorph Cell Scoring software program (Molecular Devices).

FIGREF5.text: Molecules and cytokines: AmphoB (Fisher Scientific), AmBisome (Gilead), SI-X (Sigma), SQI-Et (TefLabs), SQI-Pr (TefLabs), and Nystatin (Sigma) were used at concentrations indicated in the figures. If not otherwise noted, cells were pre-incubated with these compounds 1 hr. prior to infection by IAV. Cells were incubated with human IFN alpha at 1000 U/ml (PBL) for 16 hr. prior to infection. The AmphoB derivative, DS-AmpB-020 (David Sarlah and Erick Carreira), was dissolved in 70% ethanol and then serially diluted to achieve the concentrations indicated in the figures. Lovastatin (Mevilonin, Sigma-Aldrich) was dissolved in DMSO and diluted to 8 M using complete growth media. Methyl-beta-cyclodextrin (M CD, Sigma-Aldrich) was dissolved in sterile water and diluted to 1mM with complete growth media. Cholesterol (Sigma-Aldrich) was dissolved in 70% ethanol. Water-soluble cholesterol was generated by vortexing 40 C M CD and 40 C cholesterol to form a M CD and cholesterol solution. For AmphoB,AmBisome and oleic acid experiments, cells were incubated in either buffer (containing DMSO as needed to match), 1 mM AmphoB, 2 M AmphoB, or 3mM oleic acid (Sigma-Aldrich) at a 37°C for 1hr; then the cells were washed with fresh cold complete media before performing fusion assay as described below.Immunoblotting: Whole-cell lysates were prepared using Laemmeli buffer and resolved by SDS/PAGE. The samples were then transferred to Immobilon-P membrane(Millipore), and probed with the indicated antibodies. Please see immunoflourescence section for primary antibodies and dilutions used. Secondary anti-Rabbit HRP conjugated antibody (Jackson Immuno Research 211-062-171) was used at 1:5000. Loading controls: GAPDH (Sigma, Cat #G8795-200UL) and RAN (BD Biosciences, Cat #610340) were used at 1:2000, Actin (Sigma Cat#A2228-200UL) was used at 1:5000. Mouse infection: Background-matched wild-type (>95% C57BL/6) and Ifitm3 −/− mice(Everitt et al., 2012) 8 to10 weeks of age were maintained in accordance with UK Home Office regulations, UK Animals Scientific Procedures Act 1986 under the project license PPL80/2099(Everitt et al., 2012). This license was reviewed by The Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute Ethical Review Committee. Groups of >5 isofluoraneanaesthetized mice of both genotype were intranasally inoculated with 10 4 plaque forming units of A/X-31 influenza in 50 μl of sterile PBS (Everitt et al., 2012). On days 0, 2 and 4 the AmBisome treated mice (wild-type or matched Ifitm3 -/-) were administered 3 mg/kg of AmBisome (Gilead) intravenously. Their weight was recorded daily and they were monitored for signs of illness. Mice exceeding 25% total weight loss were killed in accordance with UK Home Office guidelines. Littermate controls were used in all experiments. Immunofluorescence staining, antibodies, and confocal microscopy: Cells on glass coverslips were fixed in 4% PFA for 10 min at room temperature, followed by incubation with 0.25% Tween 20 (Sigma) in PBS for 20 min, and then 1% BSA with 0.3M glycine (Sigma) in PBS for 30 min. After blocking with BSA, cells were probed with primary antibodies for 60 min, washed with PBS three times, and incubated with secondary antibodies for 60 min. Coverslips were mounted in Vectashield with DAPI counterstain (Vector Labs) and imaged using a Leica SP5 or AxioZeiss 510 confocal microscope. Primary antibodies: anti-NP (Millipore clone H16-L10-4R5 MAB8800 1:250, IF), anti-IFITM3 (Abgent Cat#AP1153c used at 1:50 (immunofluorescence, IF) or 1:250 (immunoblot, IB), anti-IFITM1 (Proteintech Cat #60074-1-Ig used at 1:50 (IF) or 1:1000 (IB), anti-CIL (ProSci Cat #5807) used at 1:500 (IB), and anti-acid-induced HA (anti-A1 monoclonal antibody at 1:2000 for 2 h at room temperature, a kind gift of Dr. Ari Helenius, Institute of Biochemistry, ETH Zürich, Zürich, Switzerland (Webster et al., 1983)), anti-VAPA (used at 1:200 for IB, Santa Cruz, Cat no. sc-98890; in our hands this antibody did not provide specific staining for IF using A549 cells and exogenously expressed VAPA, however a recent publication did report specific staining using this antibody (Amini-Bavil-Olyaee et al., 2013)). Secondary antibodies: Alexa Fluor 488 and 647 conjugated goat anti-rabbit and goat anti-mouse IgG (Life Technologies). Primary and secondary antibodies were diluted in 1% BSA in D-PBS and are paired as follows: IFITM3 (1:50, Abgent, Cat no. AP1153a) with Goat anti-rabbit 488 (Invitrogen, 1:1000, cat no. A11034), and LAMP1 (1:200, DSHB, H4A3-c) with goat anti-mouse 594 (Invitrogen, 1:1000, cat no. A11032). Staining with filipin (Sigma F4767, 1:1000) was done at the same time as the secondary antibodies and was performed in darkness.
